abstract.para: This guide explains how to use the &apps; (&appsshort;).

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &apps; is an easy-to-use application to install packages on a Debian-based system for the K Destop Enviroment (KDE). Modeled along the lines of Gnome Application Installer, a graphical installer based on Gnome. &appsshort; provides an easy-to-use and familiar interface with which users can perform software management operations.
&appsshort; can be started from the K menu or from the command line. In order to start &appsshort; you will be required to provide your password.

To start &apps; from the menu system select
K Menu Add/Remove Programs

No matter how you start &appsshort; root privliges will be required in order to perform the requested operations. Please use &apps; with caution since improper usage could lead to the removal, deletion, or corruption of software packages that are required to perserve system integrity.

sect2.title: Menu Bar
sect2.para: The Menu Bar Provides the following menus and options:

listitem.para: Review Changes: &appsshort; will show a list of changes that you have selected. This provides a way to make sure the changes you are committing are the ones you would like to make.
Hide Statusbar: Removes the status bar from the bottom of &appsshort;. Note: This will change to Show Statusbar to bring back the statusbar.
Configure Shortcuts: Allows you to customize the different shortcuts in &appsshort;
Adept Installer Handbook: Opens up this document for help on using &apps;
Report a Bug: Launches the a bug reporting wizard that will help improve &apps;. Works with KDE Bug Tracker.
About &apps;: Opens up a new window that provides informaton about the version of &appsshort;, the author, and the license that &apps; is under.
About KDE: Opens up a new window that provides information about the version of KDE, how and where to report bugs, and how to contribute to KDE.
